his group?  It seems somehow I got the message but it never

l=
earn a

and the

l net

cannot
> reproduce

ndered if I was

> > something silly or if it simply cannot evolve=
 a net to learn it.

> > 
=

> > Target Ou=
tput : T, which is a real number value between 0 and 1

 start genome:

> > genomestart 1
> > trait 1 0.1 0 0 0 0 0 0 0

it 2 0.2 0 0 0 0 0 0 0

ode 2 0 1 1

0 2 0 1

> > genomeend 1

 parameters:

> > trait_param_mut_prob 0.5

5

ff_coeff 0.4

resh 0.20

tate_link_trait_prob 0.1

ghts_prob 0.9

rob 0.000

nterspecies_mate_rate 0.001

t_avg_prob 0.4

ur_only_prob 0.0

 > print_every 30

> > The fitness =
function is simply to minimise the difference 
between the  
> > output and=
 target values.  A winner is declared when a network 
has at  
> > least 80=
% accuracy.

arying 
amounts
> of

still struggles 
to get

e required is a 
recurrent  
> > network with one hidden layer and it seems=
 to get that far and 
the
> best it

 it be that the best networks 
are
> being

er mutation / crossover?  Is it that I

ng the outputs into wider ranges rather than 
approximate

 >
